newsitem.title: USA: Netscape, Oracle in Internet software pact.
newsitem.headline: Netscape, Oracle in Internet software pact.

text.p: Netscape Communications Corp. and Oracle Corp., seeking to limit Microsoft Corp.'s efforts to become a dominant provider of Internet software, Monday announced a plan to integrate and market each others' products.

Netscape, whose Navigator software has more than 80 percent of the Internet browser market, and Oracle, the world's second-largest software provider, said the alliance brings together Oracle's Universal Server and so-called Network Computer products, with Netscape Commercial Applications for the Internet and Netscape's market-leading Netscape Navigator.

"While we are enormous proponents of supporting all client technologies, there are times when its more appropriate to select a closer alliance partner," said Oracle Chairman and CEO Larry Ellison. "We've chosen to work with Netscape."
